item.title: Large Banner on lamppost is not secure - serious hazard, 26th February
item.description:
The 'EA Chartered Accountants' banner mounted on the lamppost outside Sainsbury's store N12 9RE is waving about in the wind. The lower heavy duty metal bracket attached to the banner has come away from the lamppost (see photo). If there is just a moderate wind the bracket collides with the lamppost, i.e. metal on metal. The bracket poses a real danger to the public should it break away from the fabric of the banner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 863, High Road, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage gutters blocked with leaves, causing pooling of water on public footpath, 26th February
item.description:
The gutters on the public footpath at the rear of Sanford Road, Cromwell Avenue are fully blocked with leaves, causing much pooling of water and potential flooding in wet weather. The whole of the public footpath from Mason Hill to Hay Lane isnever cleaned. Much leaf debris and litter has built up there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for a Pedestrian Crossing, 26th February
item.description:
I am writing to formally request the installation of a pedestrian crossing on Woolwich Road just before the turn to Pelham Road, near Pelham primary school, where my son attends school. This road experiences a high volume of traffic, particularly during school drop-off and pick-up times and there is no pedestrian crossing on the whole lenght of this road. Vehicles frequently fail to stop to allow pedestrians to cross, which creates a dangerous situation for children, parents, and other pedestrians. I have personally witnessed several near-misses, and I am increasingly concerned for the safety of those using this crossing point daily. In addition, there is also a secondary school and a bus stop located very close to this road, meaning a large number of children and young people are required to cross it every day. The combination of heavy traffic and the absence of a designated pedestrian crossing presents a significant safety risk. I kindly ask the council to assess this area as a matter of urgency and consider the installation of a pedestrian crossing or other appropriate traffic-calming measures to improve safety for the local community. Thank you for taking the time to consider this request. I would appreciate any updates regarding possible next steps or assessments. Yours faithfully, Noelia Elliott

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
